'Local Involvement Networks (LINks)' were launched by England's National Health
Service in April 2008 following the Local Government and Public Involvement in
Health Act 2007 [http://www.opsi.gov.uk/acts/acts2007/ukpga_20070028_en_1]. They
replace the Commission for Patient and Public Involvement in Health (CPPIH)[htt-
p://www.dh.gov.uk/en/managingyourorganisation/patientandpublicinvolvement/dh_40-
31635] and Patient and Public Involvement Forums http://webarchive.national-
archives.gov.uk/+/www.dh.gov.uk/en/Managingyourorganisation/PatientAndPublicinv-
olvement/DH_4074577 and now exist in every local authority area with a
responsibility for NHS health care and social services
[http://www.nhs.uk/links]. There are now 151 LINks in place and the Government
committed Â£84 million in funding to them until March 2011.[http://www.dh.gov.uk-
/en/Managingyourorganisation/PatientAndPublicinvolvement/dh_076366]
